A-Assertions: Add assertions to TaskList, Parser, Save
MiMi project: refactor code to improve code quality
commitResults.messageBody:
Refactored multiple classes (MiMi, Parser, TaskList, Deadline, Event)
to align with SE-EDU code quality guidelines:
* removed magic strings and replaced with constants
* reduced duplication (e.g., TaskList mark/unmark, MiMi save/add)
* improved readability with guard clauses and helper methods
* strengthened encapsulation (private final fields, getters)
* improved comments to focus on WHAT/WHY instead of HOW

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch-A-Assertions: Add assertions to TaskList, Parser, and Save
commitResults.messageBody:
This merge introduces assertions into critical parts of the codebase 
to enforce invariants and catch programming errors early.

- Added assertions in TaskList to ensure valid task operations.  
- Strengthened Parser methods with assertions to validate input.  
- Updated Save operations to confirm data integrity before writing.  

These changes improve the robustness of the program and make it easier 
to detect violations of assumptions during runtime, in line with the 
objectives of the A-Assertions increment.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge master into branch-A-CodeQuality: Resolve Save.java conflicts
Merge branch-A-CodeQuality: Refactor code to improve quality
commitResults.messageBody:
Refactored multiple files to adhere to code quality guidelines:
- Replaced magic strings with constants
- Improved encapsulation by making fields private/final
- Reduced variable scope
- Removed redundant comments and improved meaningful ones
- Applied DRY principle to reduce code duplication

Also resolved merge conflicts with branch-A-Assertions in Save.java
to preserve both assertions and refactoring improvements.

commitResults.messageTitle: B-DoWithinPeriodTasks: add support for 'within period' tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Adds a new task type `DoWithinPeriodTasks` that allows users to create
Adds a new task type `DoWithinPeriodTasks` that allows users to create
tasks that must be completed within a specific time period. Each task
stores a description, a start date (`from`), and an end date (`to`).
iThis enhancement allows users to better manage tasks that have a valid

This enhancement allows users to better manage tasks that have a valid
time window (e.g., collect certificate between Jan 15 and Jan 25).
The new tasks are displayed in the list view using the `[W]` tag,
similar to existing `Deadline` and `Event` tasks.#
